meanings.definition: Taking immediate advantage, often unethically, of any circumstance of possible benefit.
meanings.sent1: The opportunistic salesman saw a chance to make extra money and took it.
meanings.sent2: She had an opportunistic approach to finding discounts and deals.
meanings.sent3: The opportunistic squirrel grabbed the last acorn before anyone else could get to it.
meanings.sent4: His opportunistic behavior in the game made him the player to watch out for.
meanings.sent5: The opportunistic cat pounced on the mouse as soon as it appeared.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or exhibiting opportunism; expedient.
meanings.sent1: The opportunistic politician changed his stance to gain more votes.
meanings.sent2: Their opportunistic actions showed a lack of long-term planning.
meanings.sent3: The opportunistic student always found a way to finish assignments at the last minute.
meanings.sent4: Her opportunistic nature allowed her to adapt quickly to new situations.
meanings.sent5: The opportunistic fox cunningly waited for the perfect moment to strike.
